faq.question: What is the difference between Rapid and Legacy accounts?
faq.answer: Rapid accounts have no daily loss limit and use end-of-day trailing drawdown, while Legacy accounts have daily loss limits and use intraday trailing drawdown. Rapid accounts are more flexible but require stricter risk management.

faq.question: How do payouts work?
faq.answer: Payouts are available after 5 trading days with minimum profit requirements. The split is 50/50 until you reach 30 Benchmark Days, then you keep 100% of profits. Minimum payouts range from $250 to $500 depending on account size.

faq.question: What are Benchmark Days?
faq.answer: Benchmark Days are profitable trading days that count toward your 30-day requirement. Once you reach 30 Benchmark Days, your profit split increases from 50/50 to 100% in your favor.

faq.question: Is there an activation fee?
faq.answer: No, there are no activation fees for FundedNext accounts. You only pay the one-time evaluation fee to start trading.

faq.question: What happens if I hit the drawdown limit?
faq.answer: If you hit the maximum drawdown limit, your account will be reset. You can purchase a reset for the same price as a new evaluation account.

faq.question: What is the consistency rule?
faq.answer: FundedNext has a 40% consistency rule. This means a single day's profit cannot make up more than 40% of the total profit target.

faq.question: What are the different account types?
faq.answer: Rapid accounts have no daily loss limit and use end-of-day trailing drawdown, while Legacy accounts have daily loss limits and use intraday trailing drawdown.

faq.question: How do payouts work?
faq.answer: Payouts are available after 5 trading days with minimum profit requirements. The split is 50/50 until you reach 30 Benchmark Days, then you keep 100% of profits.

faq.question: Can I trade during news events?
faq.answer: News trading is allowed in the Challenge Phase. For funded accounts, news trading is permitted but triggers a News-Profit-Split rule with reduced split on profits booked within the event window. High-impact events are those flagged red on the Forex Factory calendar.

faq.question: What is the minimum trading days to pass evaluation?
faq.answer: FundedNext requires 3 days minimum to pass evaluation due to the 40% consistency rule. Your biggest day cannot exceed 40% of the profit target, requiring at least 3 trading days to meet this requirement.
